meanings.definition: The state or quality of being without worth or value.
meanings.sent1: The worthlessness of the broken toy made the child sad.
meanings.sent2: She felt overwhelmed by the worthlessness of her old belongings.
meanings.sent3: The worthlessness of the empty candy wrapper made the dog wag its tail.
meanings.sent4: The worthlessness of the wilted flowers symbolized the end of summer.
meanings.sent5: The worthlessness of the rusty key was evident in its neglected state.

meanings.definition: The condition of lacking importance or significance.
meanings.sent1: The worthlessness of the small pebble went unnoticed by the hikers.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't shake off the feeling of worthlessness after the rejection.
meanings.sent3: The worthlessness of the tiny pebble in the shoe caused a big problem.
meanings.sent4: The worthlessness of the lone cloud in the sky seemed to mock the sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The worthlessness of the lone ant in the colony was a mystery to the others.
